post.description: Triggers manual processing of an intent. Checks funding status, starts the intent if needed, and initiates completion flow. Use this as a fallback when the indexer misses the funding event.

parameters.name: intentAddress
parameters.description: The blockchain address of the intent

400.description: Invalid intent status or not funded

parameters.name: chain

address.description: Token contract address on the chain

decimals.description: Number of decimal places for the token

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

get.description: Retrieves the best quote (lowest total fee) from all supported bridge protocols

bridgeFeeDetails.description: Bridge-specific fee details from the cheapest option

totalFee.description: Lowest total fee among all bridges

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

404.description: No quotes available for the route

message.example: No quotes available for this route. Please check if the route is supported.
Failed to retrieve best quote. Please try again later.

get.summary: Get best quote across all bridges

get.description: Shows Alice all her options to send money to a specific destination chain, including same-chain transfers

parameters.name: destinationChain
parameters.description: Destination blockchain where Alice wants to send money

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in human readable format (supports decimals, e.g., "1.5", "100", "0.001")

quotes.description: Quotes from all possible source chains (same-chain listed first, then sorted by cost)

cheapestOption.description: The cheapest option among all source chains

message.example: Amount must be a valid positive number

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

message.example: Failed to retrieve multi-source quotes. Please try again later.

get.summary: Get quotes from all source chains to destination

get.description: Retrieves quotes from all supported bridge protocols for comparison

message.example: Source and destination chains must be different

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

message.example: Failed to retrieve quotes. Please try again later.

get.description: Retrieves a cross-chain transfer quote from a specific bridge protocol

parameters.name: bridge
parameters.description: Bridge to use for the quote

bridgeFeeDetails.description: Bridge-specific fee details (structure varies by bridge)

totalFee.description: Total fee in token units (bridge fee + ChainRails fee)

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters or unsupported route

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

message.example: Failed to retrieve quote. Please try again later.

message.example: No bridges support route BASE_TESTNET -> STARKNET_MAINNET

bridges.description: Map of bridge names to their supported routes

bridgeCount.description: Number of bridges supporting this route

isSupported.description: Whether any bridge supports this route

api-key.description: Enter your Chainrails API key as a Bearer token

Chains.description: Source blockchain network for the deposit

sourceChain.description: Source blockchain network for the deposit

destinationChain.description: Destination blockchain network for the deposit

sender.description: Sender wallet address on the source chain

amount.description: Amount to transfer in smallest unit (e.g., wei for ETH).

tokenIn.description: Token address on the source chain

recipient.description: Recipient wallet address on the destination chain

refund_address.description: Refund address on the source chain if intent fails

relayerAddresses.description: Array of relayer addresses to add

chain.description: The blockchain network to add relayers on

relayerAddresses.description: Array of relayer addresses to remove

chain.description: The blockchain network to remove relayers from

url.description: Webhook endpoint URL (HTTPS only, or localhost for test)

events.description: Array of event types to subscribe to
